title: 107_s231
content: The Act titled "Seniors as Volunteers in Our Schools Act" references the Elementary and Secondary Education Act of 1965. It amends Section 4114(c) to include drug and violence prevention activities utilizing qualified seniors for mentoring, tutoring, and volunteering. SEC. 4. LOCAL DRUG AND VIOLENCE PREVENTION PROGRAMS. Section 4116(b) (20 U.S.C. 7116(b)) is amended to include drug and violence prevention activities utilizing appropriately qualified seniors for mentoring, tutoring, and volunteering. Section 4116(b) (20 U.S.C. 7116(b)) is amended to include drug and violence prevention activities involving appropriately qualified seniors in mentoring, tutoring, and volunteering programs. SEC. 5. NATIONAL PROGRAMS. Amends Section 4121(a) to include projects and activities involving youth and qualified seniors. SEC. 6. AUTHORIZED SERVICES AND ACTIVITIES. SEC. 6. AUTHORIZED SERVICES AND ACTIVITIES. Amends Section 9115(b) to include activities supporting the cultural and educational needs of Indian children with tribal elders and seniors. SEC. 7 amends Section 9121(c)(1) to include activities supporting the cultural and educational needs of Indian children with tribal elders and seniors. SEC. 8 amends Section 9122(d)(1) to include programs for training tribal elders and seniors. SEC. 9 focuses on Native Hawaiian community-based education learning centers. SEC. 9 amends Section 9210(b) to include programs for Native Hawaiian children that support their cultural and educational needs with qualified elders and seniors. SEC. 10 amends Section 9306(b) to include activities for Alaska Native children that recognize their cultural and educational needs with qualified elders and seniors. SEC. 11 also includes senior volunteers for gifted and talented children. SEC. 12 addresses 21st Century Community Learning Centers. SEC. 12 amends Section 10904(a)(3) to include the use of qualified seniors as volunteers in activities for 21st Century Community Learning Centers.
